page.title: 06FIELD SPORTS-King Lud's area
page.content: Leicestershire is traditionally a fox hunting county. This area is no exception being within the territory of the Belvoir Hunt. Many of the small areas of trees have been retained as cover for foxes.The fox hunting season starts in September and finishes in March. Pheasant and partridge shooting is also traditional and common in the area. The shooting is not as good as in some of the surrounding areas since it is relatively flat. Whereas in hilly areas the woodland cover would be on high ground allowing the birds to be driven over the guns in the valleys, in this area the guns and cover are at at similar level and the birds have to be artificially made to fly higher, for example by being driven over stands of coniferous trees.
